lead_paragraph: In the late 1980s, Miles Davis once told a Canadian journalist that a lot of his paintings and drawings in that period were simply "faces and lines," and that making art helped him relax. When asked how he compared to other musicians pursuing visual art at the time -- Tony Bennett, Joni Mitchell, David Bowie -- Davis added, "they paint flowers and [expletive]."
snippet: From Dec. 7 to 11, Gallery 27 in London will exhibit items from what is allegedly the final 100 available paintings of Miles Davis.

headline.main: The Art of Miles Davis, on Display in London

abstract: From Dec. 7 to 11, Gallery 27 in London will exhibit items from what is allegedly the final 100 available paintings of Miles Davis.
